question.text: For the following reaction <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>2</mn><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>+</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi><mover><mo>→</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi></mover><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi></math> the rate of reaction is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mfrac><mrow><mi mathvariant="normal">d</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow><mi>dt</mi></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi><mrow><mo>[</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></math>. Two moles of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math> are mixed with one mole of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> to make <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>1</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>0</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">L</mi></math> of solution. At <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>50</mn><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi><mo>,</mo><mo> </mo><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>5</mn></math> mole of <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math> is left in the reaction mixture. The correct statement(s) about the reaction is(are) <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mo>(</mo></math>Use: <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>ln</mi><mo> </mo><mn>2</mn><mo>=</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>693</mn><mo>)</mo></math>

options.text: The rate constant, <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi mathvariant="normal">k</mi></math>, of the reaction is <math xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mn>13</mn><mo>.</mo><mn>86</mn><mo>×</mo><msup><mn>10</mn><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></msup><msup><mrow><mo> </mo><mi mathvariant="normal">s</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>-</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></msup></math>.

solution.text:
\(\begin{array}{lllll} 
& 2 \mathrm{X}+ & \mathrm{y} & \longrightarrow & \mathrm{P} \\
\mathrm{t}=0 & 2 & 1 & & 0 \\
\mathrm{t}=50 & 2-2 \times 0.5 & 1-0.5 & & \\
& \text { 1mole } & 0.5 & &
\end{array}\)
rate \(=-\frac{1}{2} \frac{d x}{d t}=-\frac{d y}{d t}=\frac{d P}{d t}=K[X]\)
\(-\frac{1}{2} \frac{d x}{d t}=K[X]\)
\(-\frac{d x}{d t}=2 K[X]=K^1[X]\)
Half life is \(t=50 \mathrm{sec}\)
\(2 K=\frac{0.653 L}{50}\)
\(K=\frac{0.6932}{100}=6.332 \times 10^{-3}\)
\(t=50 \mathrm{sec}\)
\(-\frac{d x}{d t}=2 K[X]\)
\(-\frac{d x}{d t}=2 \times 6.332 \times 10^{-3} \times 1\)
\(=13.864 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{~mole} / \mathrm{L} / \mathrm{Sec}\)
\(-\frac{d y}{d t}=K[X]=6.332 \times 10^{-3}\left(\frac{1}{2}\right)\)
\(=3.46 \times 10^{-3} \mathrm{~mole} / \mathrm{L} / \mathrm{Sec}^{-1}\)
